intro: Packera paupercula var. balsamitae, commonly known as the Balsamita leaflet. This variant is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in alpine and subalpine regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant has narrow, serrated leaves and produces small yellow flowers in the summer. It is adapted to cold, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes.
